Get all application roles.name: Get all application roles
Get all application roles.description: Returns all application roles. In Jira, application roles are managed using the Application access configuration page.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the application role. Use the Get all application roles operation to get the key for each application role.

Get audit records.name: Get audit records
Get audit records.description: Returns a list of audit records. The list can be filtered to include items:

params.name: offset
params.description: The number of records to skip before returning the first result.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum is 1000.

params.name: filter
params.description: The query string.

params.name: from
params.description: The date and time on or after which returned audit records must have been created. If to is provided from must be before to or no audit records are returned.

params.name: to
params.description: The date and time on or before which returned audit results must have been created. If from is provided to must be after from or no audit records are returned.

Get system avatars by type.name: Get system avatars by type
Get system avatars by type.description: Returns a list of system avatar details by owner type, where the owner types are issue type, project, or user.

Get avatars.description: Returns the system and custom avatars for a project or issue type.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the entity. Valid values are project and issuetype.

params.name: entityId
params.description: The ID of the entity item.

Load avatar.name: Load avatar
Load avatar.description: Loads a custom avatar for a project or issue type.

params.description: The type of the entity. Valid values are project and issuetype.

params.name: entityId
params.description: The ID of the entity item.

params.name: x

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the crop region.

params.name: size
params.description: The length of each side of the crop region.

Delete avatar.description: Deletes an avatar from a project or issue type.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the entity. Valid values are project and issuetype.

params.name: owningObjectId
params.description: The ID of the entity item.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the avatar.

Get all dashboards.name: Get all dashboards
Get all dashboards.description: Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter applied to the list of dashboards. Valid values are:

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 1000.

Search for dashboards.name: Search for dashboards
Search for dashboards.description: Searches for dashboards. This operation is similar to Get dashboards except that the results can be refined to include dashboards that have specific attributes. For example, dashboards with a particular name. When multiple attributes are specified only filters matching all attributes are returned.

params.name: dashboardName
params.description: String used to perform a case-insensitive partial match with name.

params.name: accountId
params.description: User account ID used to return dashboards with the matching owner.accountId. This parameter cannot be used with the owner parameter.

params.name: owner
params.description: This parameter is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use accountId instead. See the migration guide for details. User name used to return dashboards with the matching owner.name. This parameter cannot be used with the accountId parameter.

params.name: groupname
params.description: Group name used to returns dashboards that are shared with a group that matches sharePermissions.group.name.

params.name: projectId
params.description: Project ID used to returns dashboards that are shared with a project that matches sharePermissions.project.id.

params.name: orderBy
params.description: Orders the results using one of these dashboard properties:

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 100.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about dashboard in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

params.description: The ID of the dashboard.

Create filter.name: Create filter
Create filter.description: Creates a filter. The filter is shared according to the default share scope. The filter is not selected as a favorite.

params.name: expand

Create filter.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/filter' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "jql": "type = Bug and resolution is empty",
  "name": "All Open Bugs",
  "description": "Lists all open bugs"
}'

params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get columns.description: Returns the columns configured for a filter. The column configuration is used when the filter's results are viewed in List View with the Columns set to Filter.

Set columns.name: Set columns
Set columns.description: Sets the columns for a filter. Only navigable fields can be set as columns. Use Get fields to get the list fields in Jira. A navigable field has navigable set to true.

Reset columns.name: Reset columns
Reset columns.description: Reset the user's column configuration for the filter to the default.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

Remove filter as favorite.name: Remove filter as favorite
Remove filter as favorite.description: Removes a filter as a favorite for the user. Note that this operation only removes filters visible to the user from the user's favorites list. For example, if the user favorites a public filter that is subsequently made private (and is therefore no longer visible on their favorites list) they cannot remove it from their favorites list.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get default share scope.description: Returns the default sharing settings for new filters and dashboards for a user.

Set default share scope.name: Set default share scope
Set default share scope.description: Sets the default sharing for new filters and dashboards for a user.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope of the default sharing for new filters and dashboards:

Get share permissions.name: Get share permissions
Get share permissions.description: Returns the share permissions for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

Add share permission.name: Add share permission
Add share permission.description: Add a share permissions to a filter. If you add a global share permission (one for all logged-in users or the public) it will overwrite all share permissions for the filter.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

Get share permission.name: Get share permission
Get share permission.description: Returns a share permission for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

params.name: permissionId
params.description: The ID of the share permission.

Delete share permission.name: Delete share permission
Delete share permission.description: Deletes a share permission from a filter.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the filter.

params.name: permissionId
params.description: The ID of the share permission.

Find users and groups.name: Find users and groups
Find users and groups.description: Returns a list of users and groups matching a string. The string is used:

params.name: query
params.description: The search string.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return in each list. The maximum is 1000.

params.name: showAvatar
params.description: Indicates whether the user avatar should be returned. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: fieldId
params.description: The custom field ID of the field this request is for.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of a project that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple projects, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, projectId=10000&projectId=10001. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

params.name: issueTypeId
params.description: The ID of an issue type that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple issue types, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, issueTypeId=10000&issueTypeId=10001. Special values, such as -1 (all standard issue types) and -2 (all subtask issue types), are supported. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

params.name: avatarSize
params.description: The size of the avatar to return. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: caseInsensitive
params.description: Indicates whether the search for groups should be case insensitive.

params.name: excludeConnectAddons
params.description: Indicates whether Connect app users and groups should be excluded from the search results. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: expand
params.description: List of fields to expand.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: Additional Properties
params.description: Extra properties of any type may be provided to this object.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: swapGroup
params.description: The group to transfer restrictions to. Only comments and worklogs are transferred. If restrictions are not transferred, comments and worklogs are inaccessible after the deletion.

Get users from group.name: Get users from group
Get users from group.description: Returns all users in a group.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: includeInactiveUsers
params.description: Include inactive users.

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

Add user to group.name: Add user to group
Add user to group.description: Adds a user to a group.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group (case sensitive).

Remove user from group.name: Remove user from group
Remove user from group.description: Removes a user from a group.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: username
params.description: This parameter is no longer available and will be removed from the documentation soon. See the deprecation notice for details.

params.name: accountId
params.description: The accountId of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192. Required.

Find groups.name: Find groups
Find groups.description: Returns a list of groups whose names contain a query string. A list of group names can be provided to exclude groups from the results.

params.name: accountId
params.description: This parameter is deprecated, setting it does not affect the results. To find groups containing a particular user, use Get user groups.

params.name: query
params.description: The string to find in group names.

params.name: exclude
params.description: A group to exclude from the result. To exclude multiple groups, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, exclude=group1&exclude=group2.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of groups to return. The maximum number of groups that can be returned is limited by the system property jira.ajax.autocomplete.limit.

params.name: userName
params.description: This parameter is no longer available and will be removed from the documentation soon. See the deprecation notice for details.

Create issue.name: Create issue
Create issue.description: Creates an issue or, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, a subtask. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or subtask to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

params.name: updateHistory
params.description: Indicates whether the project in which the issue is created is added to the user's Recently viewed project list, as shown under Projects in Jira.

Bulk create issue.name: Bulk create issue
Bulk create issue.description: Creates issues and, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, subtasks. Transitions may be applied, to move the issues or subtasks to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

params.name: Additional Properties
params.description: Extra properties of any type may be provided to this object.

Get create issue metadata.name: Get create issue metadata
Get create issue metadata.description: Returns details of projects, issue types within projects, and, when requested, the create screen fields for each issue type for the user. Use the information to populate the requests in  Create issue and Create issues.

params.name: projectIds
params.description: Comma-separated list of project IDs. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, projectIds=10000,10001&projectIds=10020,10021. This parameter may be provided with projectKeys.

params.name: projectKeys
params.description: Comma-separated list of project keys. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, projectKeys=proj1,proj2&projectKeys=proj3. This parameter may be provided with projectIds.

params.name: issuetypeIds
params.description: Comma-separated list of issue type IDs. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, issuetypeIds=10000,10001&issuetypeIds=10020,10021. This parameter may be provided with issuetypeNames.

params.name: issuetypeNames
params.description: Comma-separated list of issue type names. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, issuetypeNames=name1,name2&issuetypeNames=name3. This parameter may be provided with issuetypeIds.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about issue metadata in the response. This parameter accepts projects.issuetypes.fields which returns information about the fields in the issue creation screen for each issue type. Fields hidden from the screen are not returned. Use the information to populate the fields and update fields in Create issue and Create issues.

Get issue.name: Get issue
Get issue.description: Returns the details for an issue.

params.name: issueIdOrKey
params.description: The ID or key of the issue.

params.name: fields
params.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return for the issue. Use it to retrieve a subset of fields. Allowed values:

params.name: fieldsByKeys
params.description: Indicates whether fields in fields are referenced by keys rather than IDs. This parameter is useful where fields have been added by a connect app and a field's key may differ from its ID.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about the issues in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

params.name: properties
params.description: A comma-separated list of issue properties to return for the issue. Allowed values:

params.name: updateHistory
params.description: Indicates whether the project in which the issue is created is added to the user's Recently viewed project list, as shown under Projects in Jira. This also populates the JQL issues search lastViewed field.

Edit issue.name: Edit issue
Edit issue.description: Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.

params.name: issueIdOrKey
params.description: The ID or key of the issue.

params.name: notifyUsers
params.description: Indicates whether a notification email about the issue update is sent to all watchers. To disable the notification, administer Jira or administer project permissions are required. If the user doesn't have the necessary permission the request is ignored.

params.name: overrideScreenSecurity
params.description: Indicates whether screen security should be overridden to enable hidden fields to be edited. Available to Connect app users with admin permissions.

params.name: overrideEditableFlag
params.description: Indicates whether screen security should be overridden to enable uneditable fields to be edited. Available to Connect app users with admin permissions.

params.name: issueIdOrKey
params.description: The ID or key of the issue.

params.name: deleteSubtasks

Assign issue.description: Assigns an issue to a user. Use this operation when the calling user does not have the Edit Issues permission but has the Assign issue permission for the project that the issue is in.

params.name: issueIdOrKey

Transition issue.name: Transition issue

Get fields.name: Get fields
Get fields.description: Returns system and custom issue fields according to the following rules:

Create custom field.name: Create custom field

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the custom field, which is displayed in Jira. This is not the unique identifier.

params.name: description
params.description: The description of the custom field, which is displayed in Jira.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the custom field. For example, com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker.

params.name: searcherKey
params.description: The searcher defines the way the field is searched in Jira. For example, com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppickersearcher.The search UI (basic search and JQL search) will display different operations and values for the field, based on the field searcher. You must specify a searcher that is valid for the field type, as listed below (abbreviated values shown):

Create custom field.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/field' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "searcherKey": "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppickersearcher",
  "name": "New custom field",
  "description": "Custom field for picking groups",
  "type": "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker"
}'

Check issues against JQL.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/jql/match' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "issueIds": [
    10001,
    1000,
    10042
  ],
  "jqls": [
    "project = FOO",
    "issuetype = Bug",
    "summary ~ \"some text\" AND project in (FOO, BAR)"
  ]
}'

params.name: expand

  --url '/rest/api/3/search' \

  --data '{

    "summary ~ test AND (labels in (urgent, blocker) OR lastCommentedBy = currentUser()) AND status CHANGED AFTER startOfMonth(-1M) ORDER BY updated DESC",
    "invalid query",
    "summary = test",
    "summary in test",
    "project = INVALID",
    "universe = 42"
  ]
}'

params.name: key

params.description: The ID of the project's category. A complete list of category IDs is found using the Get all project categories operation.

  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \

  "notificationScheme": 10021,
  "description": "Example Project description",
  "lead": "Charlie",
  "url": "http://atlassian.com",
  "projectTemplateKey": "com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-simplified-process-control",

  "issueSecurityScheme": 10001,
  "name": "Example",
  "permissionScheme": 10011,
  "assigneeType": "PROJECT_LEAD",
  "projectTypeKey": "business",
  "key": "EX",
  "categoryId": 10120
}'

params.description: Deprecated. Use projectId.

params.description: The ID of the project to which this version is attached. Required when creating a version. Not applicable when updating a version.

params.description: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.

Create version.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/version' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "archived": false,
  "releaseDate": "2010-07-06T00:00:00.000Z",
  "name": "New Version 1",
  "description": "An excellent version",
  "projectId": 10000,
  "released": true
}'

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the version.

Update version.command:
curl --request PUT \
  --url '/rest/api/3/version/{id}' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "archived": false,
  "overdue": true,
  "releaseDate": "2010-07-06T00:00:00.000Z",
  "name": "New Version 1",
  "self": "http://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/~ver~/version/10000",
  "description": "An excellent version",
  "userReleaseDate": "6/Jul/2010",
  "id": "10000",
  "projectId": 10000,
  "released": true
}'

Create workflow scheme.name: Create workflow scheme

params.description: The name of the default workflow for the workflow scheme. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types assigned to it in Jira. If defaultWorkflow is not specified when creating a workflow scheme, it is set to Jira Workflow (jira).

params.name: issueTypeMappings
params.description: The issue type to workflow mappings, where each mapping is an issue type ID and workflow name pair. Note that an issue type can only be mapped to one workflow in a workflow scheme.

Get workflow transition properties.name: Get workflow transition properties
Get workflow transition properties.description: Returns the properties on a workflow transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

params.name: transitionId
params.description: The ID of the transition. To get the ID, view the workflow in text mode in the Jira administration console. The ID is shown next to the transition.

params.name: includeReservedKeys
params.description: Some properties with keys that have the jira. prefix are reserved, which means they are not editable. To include these properties in the results, set this parameter to true.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the property being returned, also known as the name of the property. If this parameter is not specified, all properties on the transition are returned.

params.name: workflowName
params.description: The name of the workflow that the transition belongs to.

params.name: workflowMode
params.description: The workflow status. Set to live for active and inactive workflows, or draft for draft workflows.

Update workflow transition property.name: Update workflow transition property
Update workflow transition property.description: Updates a workflow transition by changing the property value. Trying to update a property that does not exist results in a new property being added to the transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

params.name: transitionId
params.description: The ID of the transition. To get the ID, view the workflow in text mode in the Jira admin settings. The ID is shown next to the transition.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the property being updated, also known as the name of the property. Set this to the same value as the key defined in the request body.

params.name: workflowName
params.description: The name of the workflow that the transition belongs to.

params.name: workflowMode
params.description: The workflow status. Set to live for inactive workflows or draft for draft workflows. Active workflows cannot be edited.

params.name: workflowName

params.name: workflowMode
params.description: The workflow status. Set to live for inactive workflows or draft for draft workflows. Active workflows cannot be edited.

Delete workflow transition property.name: Delete workflow transition property
Delete workflow transition property.description: Deletes a property from a workflow transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

params.name: workflowName
